comment.body: Nicholas,  When would be a good time for me to be able to troubleshoot your Mac Ethernet issue in your office?
Would today at 1  or Monday 10-11:30 work?
Let's shoot for today around 1pm if that works for you.
Great! Thanks.

The ethernet was working at the time that I showed up this afternoon. I am placing this work order on hold for the time being and have asked Nick to comment in this work order if the issue arises again.

incident.name: Fwd: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codes
incident.description: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Hager, Steve <stevehager@augustana.edu> Date: Thu, Apr 25, 2019 at 4:31 PM Subject: Fwd: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codes To: Shawn Beattie <shawnbeattie@augustana.edu> Hello Shawn, following up with you regarding ITS laptops with ArcGIS installed for my summer GIS class, which runs from May 20 - June 2. Is it okay for me to pick up machines in the morning of Wed, May 13, and return them on Mon, June 3? I am anticipating 6 students in the class and thus we'll need to borrow 6 laptops. Not sure if these machines have GIS on them already, but if they don't the installation protocol is below. I will send you another email after this one with the authorization codes that Reuben sent me...you'll need to use one code for each machine. Thanks.  Steve ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Heine, Reuben <reubenheine@augustana.edu> Date: Mon, Mar 18, 2019 at 2:53 PM Subject: Fwd: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codes To: hager, Steve <stevehager@augustana.edu> ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Tyler Fountain <TFountain@esri.com> Date: Tue, Aug 28, 2018 at 3:56 PM Subject: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codes To: reubenheine@augustana.edu <reubenheine@augustana.edu>     Dear Instructor, Enclosed are the ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year Student License authorization codes you requested. The ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year Student License provides a 1-year term Single Use license for ArcGIS for Desktop Advanced (formerly ArcInfo) and Extensions and is limited to educational purposes (no commercial use allowed). Each authorization code is valid for one user on one computer; each student should receive a unique authorization code. You may wish to add a column to this spreadsheet to track which codes have been used or delete the codes from the spreadsheet as they are distributed to students. Please remind your students to read the instructions (see below) before they begin installing the software; students will need to activate the authorization code using their Esri Global Account before it can be used. We recommend you distribute the ArcGIS for Desktop software on a secure, internal network rather than have each student download them directly from Esri. You can either install ArcGIS for Desktop on a network server to allow students to install the software on their individual machines from a central location, or you can download the .exe file on network to allow students to download the file to their individual machines and install it locally. Please see the ArcGIS Desktop Installation Guide for details. However, if it is not possible to distribute the software on an internal network, students have the option to download the files to their individual computers. When distributing the authorization codes to students, please include the following instructions: Version 10.x - ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial software Instructions A. Before you install ArcGIS for Desktop 1. Check our system requirements to make sure your computer has the hardware and software required for the trial.   B. Activate your authorization code Visit www.esri.com/educationedition to begin the process of activating and downloading your ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial software. Log in using your Existing Esri account, or sign-up for a new Esri account, if necessary. Enter the authorization code and click Activate ArcGIS. If you need to download ArcGIS for Desktop, proceed to step 5. If you received the ArcGIS for Desktop software from your instructor or license administrator, or will be installing from a network server, proceed to step 10. Click the button for the ArcGIS for Desktop software version being activated.   C. Download and install ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial If necessary, download the ArcGIS Uninstall Utility and uninstall previous versions of ArcGIS Desktop or Server. The software cannot be installed on a computer that has a previous version of ArcGIS for Desktop or ArcGIS for Server installed. It's OK if the computer has ArcGIS Explorer installed. If necessary, install the Microsoft .NET Framework (version 3.5 Service Pack 1 or higher). If you are unsure if you have the .NetFramework installed, you can download a .net Version detector from the following site - http://www.asoft.be/prod_netver.html. Determine the location for the ArcGIS for Desktop software you wish to install and click the Download button. You can also download the Tutorial Data, if desired. Double-click ArcGIS_Desktop_10XXXXXXX.exe (Depending on the version you selected, the file extensions may be different) to extract the installation files. Locate and run Setup.exe to install ArcGIS for Desktop. The “Complete” installation is recommended. After the files are installed, the Authorization Wizard will open and prompt you to choose a product to authorize; select “ArcGIS Desktop Advanced (Single Use)” and click continue. The Authorization Wizard will prompt you for an authorization code; enter your activated code. Follow the prompts and the software will authorize and be ready for use. Note: leave the default option for the software extensions selected; they will be authorized automatically.   Support for the ArcGIS Desktop Student Trial is available at esri.com/trialhelp.   -- Reuben Heine, PhD  Hamming Endowed Chair of Geography Augustana College Ph: 309-794-7325 Office: Geoscience 207 reubenheine@augustana.edu -- Stephen B. Hager, PhD Climate Change | Nature Studies Photography | Interim Director of Field Stations Department of Biology Augustana College Rock Island, IL 61201 https://sites.google.com/augustana.edu/sbh-naturestudies/home 309.794.3439 office
incident.description_no_html:
---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Hager, Steve Date: Thu, Apr 25, 2019 at 4:31 PMSubject: Fwd: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codesTo: Shawn Beattie Hello Shawn, following up with you regarding ITS laptops with ArcGIS installed for my summer GIS class, which runs from May 20 - June 2. Is it okay for me to pick up machines in the morning of Wed, May 13, and return them on Mon, June 3? I am anticipating 6 students in the class and thus we'll need to borrow 6 laptops. Not sure if these machines have GIS on them already, but if they don't the installation protocol is below. I will send you another email after this one with the authorization codes that Reuben sent me...you'll need to use one code for each machine. Thanks.  Steve ---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Heine, Reuben Date: Mon, Mar 18, 2019 at 2:53 PMSubject: Fwd: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codesTo: hager, Steve ---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Tyler Fountain Date: Tue, Aug 28, 2018 at 3:56 PMSubject: ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year student license authorization codesTo: reubenheine@augustana.edu
    Dear Instructor , Enclosed are the ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year Student License authorization codes you requested. The ArcGIS for Desktop 1-year Student License provides a 1-year term Single Use license for ArcGIS for Desktop Advanced (formerly ArcInfo) and Extensions and is limited to educational purposes (no commercial use allowed). Each authorization code is valid for one user on one computer; each student should receive a unique authorization code. You may wish to add a column to this spreadsheet to track which codes have been used or delete the codes from the spreadsheet as they are distributed to students. Please remind your students to read the instructions (see below) before they begin installing the software; students will need to activate the authorization code using their Esri Global Account before it can be used. We recommend you distribute the ArcGIS for Desktop software on a secure, internal network rather than have each student download them directly from Esri. You can either install ArcGIS for Desktop on a network server to allow students to install the software on their individual machines from a central location, or you can download the .exe file on network to allow students to download the file to their individual machines and install it locally. Please see the ArcGIS Desktop Installation Guide for details. However, if it is not possible to distribute the software on an internal network, students have the option to download the files to their individual computers.
When distributing the authorization codes to students, please include the following instructions:
Version 10.x - ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial software Instructions A. Before you install ArcGIS for Desktop
1. Check our system requirements to make sure your computer has the hardware and software required for the trial.   B. Activate your authorization code
Visit www.esri.com/educationedition to begin the process of activating and downloading your ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial software. Log in using your Existing Esri account, or sign-up for a new Esri account, if necessary. Enter the authorization code and click Activate ArcGIS.
If you need to download ArcGIS for Desktop, proceed to step 5. If you received the ArcGIS for Desktop software from your instructor or license administrator, or will be installing from a network server, proceed to step 10.
Click the button for the ArcGIS for Desktop software version being activated.
  C. Download and install ArcGIS for Desktop Student Trial
If necessary, download the ArcGIS Uninstall Utility and uninstall previous versions of ArcGIS Desktop or Server. The software cannot be installed on a computer that has a previous version of ArcGIS for Desktop or ArcGIS for Server installed. It's OK if the computer has ArcGIS Explorer installed. If necessary, install the Microsoft .NET Framework (version 3.5 Service Pack 1 or higher).
If you are unsure if you have the .NetFramework installed, you can download a .net Version detector from the following site - http://www.asoft.be/prod_netver.html .
Determine the location for the ArcGIS for Desktop software you wish to install and click the Download button. You can also download the Tutorial Data, if desired. Double-click ArcGIS_Desktop_10XXXXXXX.exe (Depending on the version you selected, the file extensions may be different) to extract the installation files. Locate and run Setup.exe to install ArcGIS for Desktop. The “Complete” installation is recommended. After the files are installed, the Authorization Wizard will open and prompt you to choose a product to authorize; select “ ArcGIS Desktop Advanced (Single Use) ” and click continue. The Authorization Wizard will prompt you for an authorization code; enter your activated code. Follow the prompts and the software will authorize and be ready for use. Note: leave the default option for the software extensions selected; they will be authorized automatically.   Support for the ArcGIS Desktop Student Trial is available at esri.com/trialhelp .  
-- Reuben Heine, PhD   Hamming Endowed Chair of Geography Augustana College Ph: 309-794-7325 Office: Geoscience 207   reubenheine@augustana.edu -- Stephen B. Hager, PhDClimate Change | Nature Studies Photography | Interim Director of Field Stations Department of Biology Augustana College Rock Island, IL 61201 https://sites.google.com/augustana.edu/sbh-naturestudies/home 309.794.3439 office

incident.name: Unable to email from MFP
incident.description: More than one person today has been unable to scan documents and send them to email from the MFP on the library's 2nd floor (LibrLab 2-1). When you select "Finish scan," it takes a moment and then an error message appears: "Check the host name of the SMTP server on the COMMAND CENTER RX." No email sends and the job is cancelled. I know this might turn out to be an OMC question, but I thought I should try ITS because there seems to be a server issue ... ?
incident.description_no_html: More than one person today has been unable to scan documents and send them to email from the MFP on the library's 2nd floor (LibrLab 2-1). When you select "Finish scan," it takes a moment and then an error message appears: "Check the host name of the SMTP server on the COMMAND CENTER RX." No email sends and the job is cancelled. I know this might turn out to be an OMC question, but I thought I should try ITS because there seems to be a server issue ... ?
incident.resolution_description: Restarted DNS service on Freya

comment.body: P.S. After I sent this, a colleague tried shutting the printer off and on again, and also unplugging and replugging the ethernet cable. After she did this, the MFP, when she hit "Finish scan," printed out an error sheet. Then at one point, it looked like it had successfully sent an email, except the email never arrived in her inbox.
The scanner behind the circulation counter, LibraryRD, has the same problem. Both are currently displaying and printing error messages upon either finishing the scan, or logging out.

incident.resolution: Restarted DNS service on Freya

incident.name: Fwd: Teacher Computer in Olin 305
incident.description: ITS Helpdesk - Sorensen Hall 1st floor Enter and track work orders at http://helpdesk.augustana.edu Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm ph: 309-794-7293 Equipment Checkout email: equipmentcheckout@augustana.edu ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Baugous, Amanda <amandabaugous@augustana.edu> Date: Thu, Apr 25, 2019 at 11:55 AM Subject: Teacher Computer in Olin 305 To: ITS Helpdesk <helpdesk@augustana.edu> Hi, I am trying to log into the teacher's computer in Olin 305 and keep getting message that there are no logon servers available. I can log in without problem in the room next door. Any chance someone can help before class starts at 12:30??? Thank you, *Amanda M. Baugous, PhD* *Professor, Management* *Chair, Business Administration* *Augustana College, Rock Island, IL* *Click here <http://amandabaugous.youcanbook.me/> to make an appointment!* <https://www.facebook.com/AugustanaBusiness> <http://instagram.com/augustana_busn/> <https://twitter.com/AugustanaBUSN> *Follow Augustana's BUSN Dept!*
incident.description_no_html: ITS Helpdesk - Sorensen Hall 1st floor Enter and track work orders at http://helpdesk.augustana.edu Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm ph: 309-794-7293 Equipment Checkout email: equipmentcheckout@augustana.edu ---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Baugous, Amanda Date: Thu, Apr 25, 2019 at 11:55 AMSubject: Teacher Computer in Olin 305To: ITS Helpdesk Hi, I am trying to log into the teacher's computer in Olin 305 and keep getting message that there are no logon servers available. I can log in without problem in the room next door. Any chance someone can help before class starts at 12:30??? Thank you,*Amanda M. Baugous, PhD**Professor, Management**Chair, Business Administration**Augustana College, Rock Island, IL* *Click here to make an appointment!* *Follow Augustana's BUSN Dept!*

incident.name: Internet Connection
incident.description: Hello, It becomes ridiculous and annoying. The internet in Erickson went down on Tuesday night at around 11 PM. I thought it was a normal disconnection just like another 2571 times that we lost internet in Erickson throughout the year. The internet went down AGAIN last night at 10:30 PM in Erickson, Westerlin and Swanson. Ethernet cord doesn't work either. Is it a new strategy for students to go to bed early or just a terrible internet server?? Can you all please, please re-evaluate the entire internet system and make some improvement on the connections? As you are aware that right now is Week 8, it is a very stressful time for everybody. Students could be easily burned out because of finals. They can't do homework or turn in their paper without internet. I have heard complaints regarding to the internet in a regular basis. We all want our students to have a wonderful living experience at Augie, a stable internet could make it better, right? Hopefully, we will have internet tonight at 11 PM. In addition, I can't even submit a work order on my phone with data last night with the new log-in system because my user name is not authorized. Please see the attached picture. Thank you. Victor
incident.description_no_html: Hello, It becomes ridiculous and annoying. The internet in Erickson went down on Tuesday night at around 11 PM. I thought it was a normal disconnection just like another 2571 times that we lost internet in Erickson throughout the year. The internet went down AGAIN last night at 10:30 PM in Erickson, Westerlin and Swanson. Ethernet cord doesn't work either. Is it a new strategy for students to go to bed early or just a terrible internet server?? Can you all please, please re-evaluate the entire internet system and make some improvement on the connections? As you are aware that right now is Week 8, it is a very stressful time for everybody. Students could be easily burned out because of finals. They can't do homework or turn in their paper without internet. I have heard complaints regarding to the internet in a regular basis. We all want our students to have a wonderful living experience at Augie, a stable internet could make it better, right? Hopefully, we will have internet tonight at 11 PM. In addition, I can't even submit a work order on my phone with data last night with the new log-in system because my user name is not authorized. Please see the attached picture. Thank you. Victor

incident.name: .25 Internship Credit
incident.description: There is a .25 internship credit that will be starting (this summer) I think.   There is no charge for this .25 internship.  Will you need to write a rule or have something in the billing table that if a student is registered for a .25 internship there is no dollars charged? Kirk has confirmed that the .25 credit is no charge  but I wanted to check with you on what to do so we don't generate a charge for this.
incident.description_no_html: There is a .25 internship credit that will be starting (this summer) I think. There is no charge for this .25 internship. Will you need to write a rule or have something in the billing table that if a student is registered for a .25 internship there is no dollars charged? Kirk has confirmed that the .25 credit is no charge but I wanted to check with you on what to do so we don't generate a charge for this.
incident.resolution_description:
Talked with Tammy and starting in 2019-20 all internship courses will have INTR in the course number and not the department (example BIOL-INTR-01).

Modified the ARSUMMER rule which is used in the RGRT billing tables (STUDE, STUD2, DEFAULT) and is attached with the summer tuition line. The rule will now exclude .25 internship courses from being billed.

Note: Currently the .25 internship rule only applies to the summer billing table since full-time fall / spring tuition is a fix amount and will not be effected by excluding at .25 credit. However, If we discover part-time students are eligible we'll need to modify the part-time billing line.

incident.name: Accounting Program Fee
incident.description: Modify billing tables to charge any student in the accounting program (STPR_CCDS = ACCO) $1,500.00 for the year.
incident.description_no_html: Modify billing tables to charge any student in the accounting program (STPR_CCDS = ACCO) $1,500.00 for the year.
incident.resolution_description:
Create two new rules:
ARACCTFA - reg students in fall term with the ccds code ACCO
ARACCTSU - reg students in summer term with the ccds code ACCO

Modify billing tables (RGRT):
FEE1819 - add $1,500 charge using arcode ACCTF if student passes ARACCSU
FEE1920 - add $1,500 charge using arcode ACCTF if student passes ARACCFA

The summer charge will be for 2018-19 academic year and the fall charge will be for the 2019-20 academic year. This fee is for the whole academic year so the summer charge will not be used again after 2018-19. Any student that enters the program late (ie after fall term) will be manually billed by AR. An sql reporting services report called A93_ST_AR_ACCOUNTING_PROGRAM_STUDENTS will help AR monitor charges.

incident.name: manage email groups
incident.description: I recently started receiving the emails for seniorgroup, juniorgroup, etc. Is it possible to take me off these lists? thanks, Amy Copeland ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <seniorgroup@augustana.edu> Date: Wed, Apr 24, 2019 at 3:48 PM Subject: Digest for seniorgroup@augustana.edu - 25 updates in 25 topics To: Digest recipients <seniorgroup@augustana.edu> seniorgroup@augustana.edu Google Groups Topic digest View all topics Schalk Public Lecture - Thursday, April 25th @ 6:00 p.m. in Wallenberg Hall - 1 Update FREE BAGELS and COFFEE Tomorrow and Friday! If you love international travel, even better! - 1 Update ONE SPOT LEFT - SIGN UP AT PCO: IM 4 X 4 CO-ED Sand Volleyball Tournament this FRIDAY - 1 Update Open to ALL Students: 2019-2020 SAGA Editor-in-Chief - 1 Update Join us for How to Succeed...... - 1 Update Re-center yourself in goodness tonight at Weds Chapel - 1 Update Tomorrows the night - Join Us - Empower Night 3!! - 1 Update TONIGHT - Mary Poppins - 9:00 Olin Auditorium - 1 Update Augie's Tamborazo Night this Saturday!!!! - 1 Update Take Back the Night - T-shirt sales and film tonight @ 7:30 - 1 Update The Competition is On - 1 Update Missed the Last One? Get involved with MPB! - 1 Update Schalk Public Lecture - Thursday, April 25th @ 6:00 p.m. in Wallenberg Hall "Fly, Ella" <ellafly@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 03:46PM -0500 The Political Science Department is pleased to invite you to the 2019 Schalk Lecture. Dr. Elizabeth Ferris will be discussing the issues of refugees and migrants in today's world. Dr. Ferris is a research professor with the Institute for the Study of International Migration at Georgetown University's School of Foreign Service. [image: Dr_Elizabeth_Ferris_Lecture_Flyer.jpg] Back to top FREE BAGELS and COFFEE Tomorrow and Friday! If you love international travel, even better! "CORE: Study Away" <internationalprograms@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 03:47PM -0500 [image: Capture.JPG] *We are in the final stages of hiring a new Director for our International and Off-Campus Programming Office! We want YOU to meet our finalists and to provide your feedback. So if you've studied away, plan to do so in the future, or simply love travel and want to see our study away programming continue to thrive, we hope to see you tomorrow and Friday! No problem if you need to leave early or come late - we just hope you can make it! **Along with the opportunity to express your questions or concerns pertaining to the study away experience at Augustana, there will be free coffee and bagels! * *PLEASE NOTE THE CORRECT TIMES, WHICH HAVE SLIGHTLY CHANGED:* *Thursday 4/25 @ 10:30-11:15am in the Wilson Center * *Friday 4/26 @ 9:45-10:30am in Wallenberg Hall* RSVP Not Required, though donuts and bagels will be first come first serve. See you then! Don't miss this opportunity to express your questions or concerns! International & Off-Campus Programs E: internationalprograms@augustana.edu W: www.augustana.edu/studyaway An office of Back to top ONE SPOT LEFT - SIGN UP AT PCO: IM 4 X 4 CO-ED Sand Volleyball Tournament this FRIDAY "IM, Augie" <augieim@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 03:44PM -0500 *THIS FRIDAY!* * 4 x 4 Co-ed* *Sand Volleyball Tournament!* [image: image.png]! Teams must sign up at PepsiCo front desk! See details below! ____________________________________________ *Date: Friday, April 26th from 4:00 - 8:00pm* *Site: Westerlin Sand Volleyball Courts* *Registration: *Signup for this event will be on the front desk at PepsiCo. Registration open April 23 - 25. Closes at 4:00pm Thursday. Max of two teams per organization, unless we do not fill the tournament! *Manager's Meeting (game schedule): *The manager's meeting for this event will be at 5:00pm on Thursday, April 25th in the PepsiCo Lobby. Each team is required to have one representative (not necessarily the captain) in attendance. *Roster Make up:* 1) Teams must consist of a minimum two men and two women. However, a roster may have up to six members. 2) No varsity (or JV) volleyball player cannot play IM or Club Volleyball. 3) A maximum of one male and one female club volleyball player can be on a team. To score IM Cup Points for Men: Men's roster must be from same organization. Women can be from same organization OR they can be independently chosen. To score IM Cup Points for Women: Women's roster must be from same organization. Men can be from same organization OR they can be independently chosen. To score IM Cup Points for Both Men and Women: Men's and Women's roster would need to be from their respective organization. No independent players. Example: 2/3 men from Phi Omega Phi and 2/3 women from Chi Omega Gamma. *Format: *4 pools of 3 teams each (12 teams maximum). Each team will play the other 2 teams in their pool during pool play. Matches will consist of one game to 25 points rally scoring. There will be pool play starting the day and a single elimination tournament for the top two teams in each pool following pool play. *Pool Play Schedule:* Pools A & B: Games at 4:00 - 4:25 - 4:50pm Pools C & D: Games at 5:15 - 5:40 - 6:05pm Quarterfinal Games: 6:30 & 6:55pm Semi-final Games: 7:20pm Championship and 3rd Place Game: 7:45pm *Event: *The Intramural Staff will be overseeing the event and has final decision on any disputes. *Department of Intramurals, Augustana College* *PepsiCo Recreation Center* *1025 30th Street* *Rock Island, IL 61201* *(309) 794-7816 <%28309%29%20794-7816>* Back to top Open to ALL Students: 2019-2020 SAGA Editor-in-Chief "Sanders-Ring, Christina" <christinasandersring@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 03:01PM -0500 Sooner or later, you may need to know *at least a little bit *about managing a team, making critical choices, or coordinating a project with a tangible product. *GOOD NEWS!* *You can get all kinds of practice as the Editor-in-Chief of SAGA, Augustana's annual publication of student creative work.* *SOUNDS GREAT! HOW DO I APPLY?* - Complete the attached application form - Submit your completed application form (no later than May 4!) - Hand-deliver to Rebecca Wee in Old Main 123 -- *or* - Email to *rebeccawee@augustana.edu* <rebeccawee@augustana.edu> *About SAGA: {website <http://sagamagazine.wixsite.com/saga/about-saga>} {facebook <https://www.facebook.com/SagaArtsLiteraryMagazine/>}* Back to top Join us for How to Succeed...... "Myatt, Christina" <christinamyatt@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 02:44PM -0500 [image: 159-326a_How_to_Succeed_FB_Banner.jpg] *Augustana College Theatre Department to finish mainstage season with the Frank Loesser and Abe Burrows musical* *How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying* Augustana College Theatre Arts Department will present *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying, *book by Abe Burrows, Jack Weinstock, and Willie Gilbert, music and lyrics by Frank Loesser in the Brunner Mainstage Theatre April 26-28 amd May 3-5, 2019 Big business means big laughs in this delightfully clever lampoon of life on the corporate ladder. A tune-filled comic gem that took Broadway by storm, winning both the Tony Award for Best Musical and a Pulitzer Prize, *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying *boasts an exhilarating score by Frank Loesser, including "I Believe in You," "Brotherhood of Man" and "The Company Way." A satire of big business and all it holds sacred, *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying* follows the rise of J. Pierrepont Finch, who uses a little handbook called *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying* to climb the corporate ladder from lowly window washer to high-powered executive, tackling such familiar but potent dangers as the aggressively compliant "company man," the office party, backstabbing coworkers, caffeine addiction and, of course, true love. The cast includes Augustana students Rami Halbi as J. Pierrepont Finch, Lauren Larson as Rosemary, Drew Gilson as J.B. Biggley, Daniel Williams as Bert Bratt, Muriel Melgoza as Smitty, Brycen Witt as Bud Frump, Cheyenne Powell as Miss Jones, and Abby Overman as Hedy. Augustana students Alexis Downey and Kascia Olechno serve as assistant director and stage manager, respectively. Rae Ellen Walker serves as scenic and lighting designer, Emma Brutman as technical director and Ellen Dixon is the costume designer. The production is directed and choreographed by assistant professor Shelley Cooper with music direction by Dr. Michelle Crouch. Asked about the show, director Shelley Cooper said, “I am having an absolute BALL working with a dynamite cast and production team of 65+ Augustana College students! Through directing this piece, I have been very inspired by Walter Kerr of the New York Herald's quote from 1961 stating: "Not a sincere line is spoken in the new Abe Burrows-Frank Loesser musical, and what a relief that is...*How to Succeed* is crafty, conniving, sneaky, cynical, irreverent, impertinent, sly, malicious, and lovely, just lovely." We have been having a lot of fun in rehearsals exploring the fact that there is truth in comedy, uncomfortable/awkward life moments, 3 dimensional characters with interesting relationships interactions, and in your face, fast paced, episodic structure; the show does not stop moving! We have been grappling with serious issues such as toxic masculinity in the work force, but how there is slight hope for change." Public performances of the show will be presented in the Brunner Mainstage Theatre, Brunner Theatre Center, April 26-28 and May 3-4 at 7:30pm and May 5 at 1:30pm. Tickets are $15 for the general public, $12 for senior citizens and Augustana faculty/staff, $10 for students and children ages 12 and under, and FREE for Augustana students with ID. Tickets can be purchased through the Augustana Ticket Office (309) 794.7306 or by visiting augustana.edu/tickets. *Christina Myatt* Augustana College Department of Theatre Arts Company Manager Mississippi Bend Players christinamyatt@augustana.edu 309.794.7611 Back to top Re-center yourself in goodness tonight at Weds Chapel "Ministries, Campus" <campusministries@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 02:06PM -0500 *Everyone needs a little peace and quiet* *a time to reflect* *a chance to catch your breath* *So take advantage of...* Wednesday Chapel *TONIGHT* and every Wednesday *9:00 p.m.* *Ascension Chapel* 2nd Floor, Founders Hall [image: handcandle.jpg] *friends* *singing* *scripture* *prayer* *candles* *communion* *peace* *quiet* *reflection* Back to top Tomorrows the night - Join Us - Empower Night 3!! "Huntley, Connie" <conniehuntley@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 02:00PM -0500 Come take a study break and join us for our third ever… *EMPOWER* Worship Night [image: image.png] When: *THIS THURSDAY* April 25th Where: Wallenberg Hall (2nd floor of Denkmann) Time: *8:00pm-9:00ish* Theme: This night is centered all around *EASTER!!* What is EMPOWER? - A place where one can come and reflect, praise, or sing at the top of your lungs - A place where one feels comfortable, loved and accepted - A time to relax and worship with others around you Come take a short study break with us!!! If you have any questions feel free to contact Brooke Harmon (brookeharmon16@augustana.edu) OR Melanie Loeffler ( melanieloeffler16@augstana.edu) Back to top TONIGHT - Mary Poppins - 9:00 Olin Auditorium Office of Student Life <studentactivity@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 01:37PM -0500 *TONIGHT* *"Trip a Little Light Fantastic" and come see…* MARY POPPINS RETURNS [image: unnamed.gif] *Step in time!* Because "Mary Poppins Returns" will be shown in the *Olin Auditorium* *TONIGHT*, *Wednesday April 24th* at *9pm* AND *Friday April 26th *at *7pm & 10pm*! Heres the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-3jsfXDZLIY See you there! Back to top Augie's Tamborazo Night this Saturday!!!! Office of Student Life <studentactivity@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 12:48PM -0500 Do you like listening to music from different cultures? Need something to do Saturday night? Want *FREE* tacos? [image: Related image] If you said yes to any of these questions, then you should check out* MPB*'s Augie's Tamborazo Night on Saturday, April 27th from 6-8pm in the Upper Quad (or the Brew as rain location)! [image: IMG_2590.jpeg] Here's a sneak peek <https://youtu.be/yoDx0U0IaOs> of what to expect from the group.... Back to top Take Back the Night - T-shirt sales and film tonight @ 7:30 "Simonsen, Jane" <janesimonsen@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 11:25AM -0500 Stop by the Brew today between 11 & 3 p.m. to show your support for survivors - Take Back the Night T-shirts & wristbands for sale; free buttons *TONIGHT* Sponsored by the WGST Department: TAKE BACK THE NIGHT MOVIE SHOWING! April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month and in support of Take Back the Night (happening Sunday, April 28th) ... The HUNTING GROUND will be shown Wednesday, April 24th, 2019 @ 7:30 pm in Olin 305 Trigger Warning: The movie contains explicit descriptions of sexual assault. For anyone who may need support before, during, and after the movie Emilee Goad, a Safe Path counselor, will be available during and after the movie showing to assist anyone who may need it. We want all individuals in attendance to feel safe and comfortable so attached there is a link of the trailer for the movie. https://youtu.be/GBNHGi36nlM Back to top The Competition is On Student Government <sga@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 11:07AM -0500 This week you can participate in a competition for... *BIRDHOUSES AND RECYCLING!* SGA's Rotating Committee is hosting *TWO *events this week to promote sustainability during *Earth Week.* Here's the info: *BIRDHOUSES* Over 20 student organizations decorated birdhouses yesterday and all of them look PHENOMENAL! *Today and tomorrow from 3pm-6pm* there will be voting in the Brew! All of the birdhouses will be displayed and you can vote by placing and money (coins or cash) into the group's donation bag. All of the money will go towards funding a campus sustainability project. The organizations that has raised the most money for their birdhouse will get to *CHOOSE A PRIME LOCATION* for their birdhouse and will receive* WHITEY'S ICE CREAM* at their organization's meeting. *BATTLE OF THE BOTTLES* Boxes have been placed in all of the residence halls and the competition has STARTED and will go until the end of the week! *Check this doc for the most recent updates about the competition:* Battle of the Bottles - Bottle Count <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KU4t1_ql8j3jntzfr4xdbfyUql6H5eUNlpffCZdB_M8/edit?usp=sharing> To make it fair, we will be ranking the competition by bottles per person within each residence hall since some res halls are larger than others. [image: BOTB.png] Please email kaitlynwatkins17@augustana.edu with any questions or concerns. *Don't be trashy. Recycle. * Back to top Missed the Last One? Second Info Meeting for Global Medical Brigades "Casas, Cassy" <cassycasas@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 10:04AM -0500 Hello everyone! If you are interested in empowering communities worldwide and learning about and working towards reducing inequalities in global health, come check out *Global Medical Brigades *this Thursday, *April 25th* *at 7:00 pm in Gavle 2*! Global Medical Brigades is a branch of Global Brigades, an international organization that encompasses the largest student-led movement for global health. Global Brigades' volunteers collaboratively work together with community partners to achieve sustainable health and economic goals. As the first Augustana chapter, we will be hosting events such as health panel discussions, getting clinical hours through shadowing and volunteering, as well as planning fundraising activities. All funds that we may potentially collect through fundraising will go towards sponsoring Augustana students to *travel abroad to help underprivileged communities!* [image: Global Med Brigades.jpg] Back to top The Dish on Dining ~ Let's Go Local Lunch! "Melton, Elizabeth" <elizabethmelton@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 09:43AM -0500 [image: Picture1.png] *Thursday, April 25*, *Dining Services *will be celebrating *Earth Week * by going local! Flashback to last year's #LetsGoLocal <https://www.facebook.com/hashtag/letsgolocal?source=feed_text&epa=HASHTAG&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARA4EkcFfY_35WMf86lamt9iRPImeC8lmaiJedLBtitRnTK6W65TkF8TKPkELqB0-qXqcncqErRrR04cRkPpcyRrkTUIQJokhCOQwtP8BZeaKqFu-ujzGjA4Xx7tzCCEKcM3D2SxNk_u1QcEJUmoAiYT2C6lXaEhrnt_xRYAhwf-Ha1Z4dGt-ZJP2A8nUzpttgPy4V7c_j00VQLMSRlZcadJIMN5rzVraeZ1f4LexVGavbJ3bMjRK2BVpHrISjdRvyvWiICu_pddEXGi-TZEBF0Wc-hW32J6 PnLtesIqxv-Oi0F2j8B4Os370iKm-9ZSlpRfsUpfW0dJo5P6FIjyOCSbMqFCcTbpZREGMr4H2_UnKzrsQqcloKiNG6JT6H20oxiDpTEB7cF46zzACF9NMgodXQVK-tTVnkwaaWGeC-A6nb5b-xTYpCoCfnoxhn-Xlq15iXYbwfUwu7jSZPmq643geqxcR-j8BiM32xOF9E27b4xn9fgdsKhZ&__tn__=%2ANK-R> lunch, the burgers were so popular, even Fred, our Dining Manager, was helping with the grilling! [image: 31381110_2095500770465589_5866636588569591808_n.jpg] We have 200 patties ready this year from Sawyer Beef <https://www.facebook.com/Sawyerbeef/?__tn__=K-R&eid=ARA1Ok4ozXg08tuGE1zK0DwFeMbOgZ__13ZzFGNpg3zR_nBafPPRG1OSUYFuXQdDTcqTQ_K0UX4yVZKI&fref=mentions&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARA4EkcFfY_35WMf86lamt9iRPImeC8lmaiJedLBtitRnTK6W65TkF8TKPkELqB0-qXqcncqErRrR04cRkPpcyRrkTUIQJokhCOQwtP8BZeaKqFu-ujzGjA4Xx7tzCCEKcM3D2SxNk_u1QcEJUmoAiYT2C6lX aEhrnt_xRYAhwf-Ha1Z4dGt-ZJP2A8nUzpttgPy4V7c_j00VQLMSRlZcadJIMN5rzVraeZ1f4LexVGavbJ3bMjRK2BVpHrISjdRvyvWiICu_pddEXGi-TZEBF0Wc-hW32J6PnLtesIqxv-Oi0F2j8B4Os370iKm-9ZSlpRfsUpfW0dJo5P6FIjyOCSbMqFCcTbpZREGMr4H2_UnKzrsQqcloKiNG6JT6H20oxiDpTEB7cF46zzACF9NMgodXQVK-tTVnkwaaWGeC-A6nb5b-xTYpCoCfnoxhn-Xlq15iXYbwfUwu7jSZPmq643geqxcR-j8BiM32xOF9E27b4xn9fgdsKhZ> out of Princeton, Iowa. Want a little more homegrown flavor to your burger? Top it with an over easy egg from Farmers Hen House <https://www.facebook.com/farmershenhouseiowa/?__tn__=K-R&eid=ARAGvqVqXz5yomWLXc3Zdobg8SemgrT40Vsk7ecDJY1S0qObpdXaWQuFibq-7t-4tdPxoNuOjVX6QOZU&fref=mentions&__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARA4EkcFfY_35WMf86lamt9iRPImeC8lmaiJedLBtitRnTK6W65TkF8TKPkELqB0-qXqcncqErRrR04cRkPpcyRrkTUIQJokhCOQwtP8BZeaKqFu-ujzGjA4Xx7tzCCEKcM3D2SxNk_ u1QcEJUmoAiYT2C6lXaEhrnt_xRYAhwf-Ha1Z4dGt-ZJP2A8nUzpttgPy4V7c_j00VQLMSRlZcadJIMN5rzVraeZ1f4LexVGavbJ3bMjRK2BVpHrISjdRvyvWiICu_pddEXGi-TZEBF0Wc-hW32J6PnLtesIqxv-Oi0F2j8B4Os370iKm-9ZSlpRfsUpfW0dJo5P6FIjyOCSbMqFCcTbpZREGMr4H2_UnKzrsQqcloKiNG6JT6H20oxiDpTEB7cF46zzACF9NMgodXQVK-tTVnkwaaWGeC-A6nb5b-xTYpCoCfnoxhn-Xlq15iXYbwfUwu7jSZPmq643geqxcR-j8BiM32xOF9E27b4xn9fgdsKhZ> ! For more #LetsGoLocal lunch information, check out our Facebook Page! Augustana College Dining Services -- Beth Melton Dining Services Accounts Assistant Back to top Are you ready to Relay? "Aden, Christine" <christineaden@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 09:38AM -0500 Do you enjoy Zumba and bingo? Do you want to watch others battle it out in a high heel dash? If yes, then register for Relay for Life <http://main.acsevents.org/site/TR/RelayForLife/RFLCY19NCR?pg=entry&fr_id=93261> via the website or by downloading the Relay For Life app. Come join your peers in supporting the American Cancer Society *THIS FRIDAY* in PepsiCo from 6pm to midnight! We welcome ALL Greek groups, clubs, and individuals at this event. You DO NOT need to be in a group to register! We hope to see you there! Kassidy Belcher and your Relay for Life team *Christine Aden, MA in LISHead of CirculationAugustana College, Thomas Tredway Library639 38th StreetRock Island, IL 61201(309)794-7819* Back to top Honor someone who is or has fought cancer "Aden, Christine" <christineaden@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 09:38AM -0500 One special way you can honor those who we have lost to cancer, or support those who are currently fighting is to buy $1 Luminaria bag that will become a part of a really important ceremony at the Relay For Life event Friday, April 26th. Decorate this bag with the name of those who have been touched with cancer. Venmo accepted! See us in the brew this week Tues-Friday [image: Relay for life luminaria bags for sale (1).png] For further information, stop by the Brew table or email alexaprejna15@augustana.edu. *Christine Aden, MA in LISHead of CirculationAugustana College, Thomas Tredway Library639 38th StreetRock Island, IL 61201(309)794-7819* Back to top Voting Issues & Extension Student Government <sga@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 09:37AM -0500 Students, We understand that you may be experiencing issues while voting for your respective Senators. Through working with ITS we have found that the fastest way to fix this issue is to change everything manually. Please send us an email if you are having issues and we will help you get it fixed. That being said, we understand that this could have had an impact on your time to vote so voting has been extended until Thursday at Midnight. Haley DeGreve & Carl Frasor President & Vice President-Elect Back to top Heywire Show Saturday @ 8pm!! "Kaul, Adam" <adamkaul@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 08:43AM -0500 Heywire proudly presents: *Anywhere But Chili's * [image: image.png] Come see Heywire perform *live improv comedy* this *S**aturday, April 27th at 8pm!!* We will be in *Potter Hall in Bergendoff*. Do NOT go to Chili's. This show will *not* be taking place at Chili's. I repeat. *NOT CHILI'S.* 8pm. Potter Hall (not Chili's). Back to top TODAY: Wear Denim! "Violence Prevention, Sexual Health" <shvp@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 08:26AM -0500 Dear Campus Community, Join us in standing up for what is right! The words expressed in the recent Twitter video do not align with the college's values or all of the hard work so many of our students, faculty, and staff do to help end sexual violence. The language or the actions of a few should never represent our campus community as a whole, and we would like to take a stand together as a campus on Wednesday April 24th by participating in Denim Day. This campaign was started 20 years ago, after a ruling by the Italian Supreme Court where a rape conviction was overturned because the justices felt that since the victim was wearing tight jeans she must have helped the person who raped her remove her jeans, thereby implying consent. The following day, the women in the Italian Parliament came to work wearing jeans in solidarity with the victim. We encourage you, your athletic team, your Greek group, your department, your co-curricular organization, your res hall floor, and your classes to wear denim on Wednesday, April 24, as a show of solidarity for supporting survivors. Help us show that our campus community will not be defined by the voices of a few, and together we believe and respect survivors. *Take a picture of you or your group in their denim with the attached poster and email it to emileegoad@augustana.edu or post to social media using the hashtag #Augie4Survivors. * *Stickers and posters will be available in the Brew and OSL office throughout the day!* For additional background, visit https://www.denimdayinfo.org/. Emilee Goad SHVP Coordinator and the SHVP Committee Back to top Sleep survey for a class project "Marme, Mamata" <mamatamarme@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 08:21AM -0500 Hi all, Maxx Carpenter, Bradley Heinrichs, Tommy Dyer, and Jake Slavin are interested in building a model that will help predict factors that affect the hours of sleep a student at Augustana gets. This is a component in their final project for BUSN 212. The survey, linked below, has been approved by the Institutional Review Board. It should take about 10 minutes to complete the survey. We will not be collecting any personal information like e-mail addresses and so the answers you provide are completely anonymous. If you have any questions, please feel free to e-mail me at mamatamarme@augustana.edu. Thank you. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1nbvDkxoDglcS019bQrp8_S9doDqF8OgExDITnqzuBOk/edit?ts=5cbfc1ab Mamata Marmé, M.Stat(Indian Statistical Institute), MS(UIUC). Link to my calendar: https://www.google.com/calendar/selfsched?sstoken=UU12NHp4S3UtQ19ofGRlZmF1bHR8ZGM2NDcyMjQ3OTc5ODhiMTU4ZTVmYWRjZThmMDY4NWM Director of Academic Advising, *Department of Business Administration, *Augustana College Evald 312 309 794 7261 Back to top Volunteer hour opportunity at Augie Acres this morning Augie Acres <augieacres@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 07:28AM -0500 Hey, campus community! Do you need volunteer hours? Do you want to start your day out right by spending some time outside? Come on down to Augie Acres from 10 to 11 this morning for the work party of the century! Corner of 6th Ave. and 34th St.! Everybody eats, ALAS Back to top TODAY: Incarceration Reform lectures, April 24 and TOMORROW April 25 "Meyers, Laura" <laurameyers@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 07:06AM -0500 *Mark your calendars for two upcoming lectures on* *Incarceration Reform* *April 24 and 25, 2019* [image: Stateville.jpg] *Wednesday, April 24, 4:30 PM, Wilson Center* *“Rethinking Incarceration: **Advocating for Justice That Restores"* *Dominique DuBois Gilliard* Rev. Gilliard will be speaking about his book *Rethinking Incarceration <https://www.ivpress.com/rethinking-incarceration>* (2018). He is director of racial righteousness and reconciliation for the Evangelical Covenant Church. He serves on the boards of directors for the Christian Community Development Association and Evangelicals for Justice, and was identified by *Huffington Post* as one of the “Black Christian Leaders Changing the World." *Thursday, April 25, 4:30 PM, Hanson 102* *“Resisting Incarceration Through Education"* *Michelle Clifton-Soderstrom* Dr. Clifton-Soderstrom will be speaking about her work teaching at Stateville Correctional Facility outside of Chicago, where she is Professor of Theology and Ethics at North Park Theological Seminary. You can read about her work in *Sojourners,* "Resisting Incarceration Through Education <https://sojo.net/articles/resist-mass-incarceration-through-education>," and in the *Covenant Companion*, "Letters from Stateville <https://covenantcompanion.com/2016/11/07/letters-from-stateville/>." [image: Center for Faith and Learning.jpg] *Sponsored by the Augustana Presidential Center for Faith and Learning and the Marianne and Marcus Wallenberg Foundation.* Attachments area Preview attachment Incarceration Reform.pdf Incarceration Reform.pdf 456 KB <https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=08bd64b8b2&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-f:1631613439142128958&th=16a4a7c73ad1ed3e&view=att&disp=inline&realattid=f_jucx0n1p2> Back to top Wednesday Earth Week Schedule Augie Acres <augieacres@augustana.edu>: Apr 24 07:05AM -0500 Hello Augustana Community, Today's Earth Week events are as follows: *Home Aquaponics Systems - 5:30 PM Old Main 117* Augie student Eden Nimietz discusses how to set up your own home aquaponics system and the benefits of having an aquaponics system in your home. The Organic Home Product Making Workshop has been *CANCELLED. * Social Greek Chapters - These events count for Greek Week points! Have a wonderful Wednesday, everybody eats! ALAS Back to top Tomorrow: Take a stand against Sexual Violence "Violence Prevention, Sexual Health" <shvp@augustana.edu>: Apr 23 10:07PM -0500 Dear Campus Community, Join us in standing up for what is right! The words expressed in the recent Twitter video do not align with the college's values or all of the hard work so many of our students, faculty, and staff do to help end sexual violence. The language or the actions of a few should never represent our campus community as a whole, and we would like to take a stand together as a campus on Wednesday April 24th by participating in Denim Day. This campaign was started 20 years ago, after a ruling by the Italian Supreme Court where a rape conviction was overturned because the justices felt that since the victim was wearing tight jeans she must have helped the person who raped her remove her jeans, thereby implying consent. The following day, the women in the Italian Parliament came to work wearing jeans in solidarity with the victim. We encourage you, your athletic team, your Greek group, your department, your co-curricular organization, your res hall floor, and your classes to wear denim on Wednesday, April 24, as a show of solidarity for supporting survivors. Help us show that our campus community will not be defined by the voices of a few, and together we believe and respect survivors. Take a picture of you or your group in their denim with the attached poster and email it to emileegoad@augustana.edu or post to social media using the hashtag #Augie4Survivors. Stickers and posters will be available in the Brew and OSL office throughout the day! Back to top Documentary showing in 15 minutes! Augie Acres <augieacres@augustana.edu>: Apr 23 06:48PM -0500 Come to Hanson 304 to view Sustainable, a documentary about sustainable farming in Illinois! Starts at 7 TONIGHT! ALAS Back to top Are you interested in planning events like Culture Fest or the Chicago Retreat?! Get involved with MPB! Office of Student Life <studentactivity@augustana.edu>: Apr 23 05:41PM -0500 Hello Augie Students! Are you passionate about uniting the community through outreach and cultural education? Would you like to be involved in planning events like Culture Fest, the Chicago Fire Game Excursion, or the Last Comic Standing?! If so, come and meet OSL's Multicultural Programming Board committees like Special events, Comedy, Campus Awareness and Outreach, and many more fun committees. MPB will be hosting a committee fair Monday, April 29th in Hanson 304 from 5-6pm! We will be providing drinks and snacks for those who attend!! We can't wait to meet you all! See details below! ____________________________________________ *Date: Friday, April 26th from 4:00 - 8:00pm* *Site: Westerlin Sand Volleyball Courts* *Registration: *Signup for this event will be on the front desk at PepsiCo. Registration open April 23 - 25. Closes at 4:00pm Thursday. Max of two teams per organization, unless we do not fill the tournament! *Manager's Meeting (game schedule): *The manager's meeting for this event will be at 5:00pm on Thursday, April 25th in the PepsiCo Lobby. Each team is required to have one representative (not necessarily the captain) in attendance. *Roster Make up:* 1) Teams must consist of a minimum two men and two women. However, a roster may have up to six members. 2) No varsity (or JV) volleyball player cannot play IM or Club Volleyball. 3) A maximum of one male and one female club volleyball player can be on a team. To score IM Cup Points for Men: Men's roster must be from same organization. Women can be from same organization OR they can be independently chosen. To score IM Cup Points for Women: Women's roster must be from same organization. Men can be from same organization OR they can be independently chosen. To score IM Cup Points for Both Men and Women: Men's and Women's roster would need to be from their respective organization. No independent players. Example: 2/3 men from Phi Omega Phi and 2/3 women from Chi Omega Gamma. *Format: *4 pools of 3 teams each (12 teams maximum). Each team will play the other 2 teams in their pool during pool play. Matches will consist of one game to 25 points rally scoring. There will be pool play starting the day and a single elimination tournament for the top two teams in each pool following pool play. *Pool Play Schedule:* Pools A & B: Games at 4:00 - 4:25 - 4:50pm Pools C & D: Games at 5:15 - 5:40 - 6:05pm Quarterfinal Games: 6:30 & 6:55pm Semi-final Games: 7:20pm Championship and 3rd Place Game: 7:45pm *Event: *The Intramural Staff will be overseeing the event and has final decision on any disputes. *Department of Intramurals, Augustana College* *PepsiCo Recreation Center* *1025 30th Street* *Rock Island, IL 61201* *(309) 794-7816 <%28309%29%20794-7816>* Back to top

Join us for How to Succeed......
"Myatt, Christina" : Apr 24 02:44PM -0500 [image: 159-326a_How_to_Succeed_FB_Banner.jpg] *Augustana College Theatre Department to finish mainstage season with the Frank Loesser and Abe Burrows musical* *How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying* Augustana College Theatre Arts Department will present *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying, *book by Abe Burrows, Jack Weinstock, and Willie Gilbert, music and lyrics by Frank Loesser in the Brunner Mainstage Theatre April 26-28 amd May 3-5, 2019 Big business means big laughs in this delightfully clever lampoon of life on the corporate ladder. A tune-filled comic gem that took Broadway by storm, winning both the Tony Award for Best Musical and a Pulitzer Prize, *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying *boasts an exhilarating score by Frank Loesser, including "I Believe in You," "Brotherhood of Man" and "The Company Way." A satire of big business and all it holds sacred, *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying* follows the rise of J. Pierrepont Finch, who uses a little handbook called *How to Succeed in Business without Really Trying* to climb the corporate ladder from lowly window washer to high-powered executive, tackling such familiar but potent dangers as the aggressively compliant "company man," the office party, backstabbing coworkers, caffeine addiction and, of course, true love. The cast includes Augustana students Rami Halbi as J. Pierrepont Finch, Lauren Larson as Rosemary, Drew Gilson as J.B. Biggley, Daniel Williams as Bert Bratt, Muriel Melgoza as Smitty, Brycen Witt as Bud Frump, Cheyenne Powell as Miss Jones, and Abby Overman as Hedy. Augustana students Alexis Downey and Kascia Olechno serve as assistant director and stage manager, respectively. Rae Ellen Walker serves as scenic and lighting designer, Emma Brutman as technical director and Ellen Dixon is the costume designer. The production is directed and choreographed by assistant professor Shelley Cooper with music direction by Dr. Michelle Crouch. Asked about the show, director Shelley Cooper said, “I am having an absolute BALL working with a dynamite cast and production team of 65+ Augustana College students! Through directing this piece, I have been very inspired by Walter Kerr of the New York Herald's quote from 1961 stating: "Not a sincere line is spoken in the new Abe Burrows-Frank Loesser musical, and what a relief that is...*How to Succeed* is crafty, conniving, sneaky, cynical, irreverent, impertinent, sly, malicious, and lovely, just lovely." We have been having a lot of fun in rehearsals exploring the fact that there is truth in comedy, uncomfortable/awkward life moments, 3 dimensional characters with interesting relationships interactions, and in your face, fast paced, episodic structure; the show does not stop moving! We have been grappling with serious issues such as toxic masculinity in the work force, but how there is slight hope for change." Public performances of the show will be presented in the Brunner Mainstage Theatre, Brunner Theatre Center, April 26-28 and May 3-4 at 7:30pm and May 5 at 1:30pm. Tickets are $15 for the general public, $12 for senior citizens and Augustana faculty/staff, $10 for students and children ages 12 and under, and FREE for Augustana students with ID. Tickets can be purchased through the Augustana Ticket Office (309) 794.7306 or by visiting augustana.edu/tickets. *Christina Myatt* Augustana College Department of Theatre Arts Company Manager Mississippi Bend Players christinamyatt@augustana.edu 309.794.7611 Back to top

"Violence Prevention, Sexual Health" : Apr 23 10:07PM -0500 Dear Campus Community, Join us in standing up for what is right! The words expressed in the recent Twitter video do not align with the college's values or all of the hard work so many of our students, faculty, and staff do to help end sexual violence. The language or the actions of a few should never represent our campus community as a whole, and we would like to take a stand together as a campus on Wednesday April 24th by participating in Denim Day. This campaign was started 20 years ago, after a ruling by the Italian Supreme Court where a rape conviction was overturned because the justices felt that since the victim was wearing tight jeans she must have helped the person who raped her remove her jeans, thereby implying consent. The following day, the women in the Italian Parliament came to work wearing jeans in solidarity with the victim. We encourage you, your athletic team, your Greek group, your department, your co-curricular organization, your res hall floor, and your classes to wear denim on Wednesday, April 24, as a show of solidarity for supporting survivors. Help us show that our campus community will not be defined by the voices of a few, and together we believe and respect survivors. Take a picture of you or your group in their denim with the attached poster and email it to emileegoad@augustana.edu or post to social media using the hashtag #Augie4Survivors. Stickers and posters will be available in the Brew and OSL office throughout the day! Back to top
Documentary showing in 15 minutes!
Augie Acres : Apr 23 06:48PM -0500 Come to Hanson 304 to view Sustainable, a documentary about sustainable farming in Illinois! Starts at 7 TONIGHT! ALAS Back to top
Are you interested in planning events like Culture Fest or the Chicago Retreat?! Get involved with MPB!
Office of Student Life : Apr 23 05:41PM -0500 Hello Augie Students! Are you passionate about uniting the community through outreach and cultural education? Would you like to be involved in planning events like Culture Fest, the Chicago Fire Game Excursion, or the Last Comic Standing?! If so, come and meet OSL's Multicultural Programming Board committees like Special events, Comedy, Campus Awareness and Outreach, and many more fun committees. MPB will be hosting a committee fair Monday, April 29th in Hanson 304 from 5-6pm! We will be providing drinks and snacks for those who attend!! We can't wait to meet you all! Back to top
You received this digest because you're subscribed to updates for this group. You can change your settings on the group membership page. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it send an email to seniorgroup+unsubscribe@augustana.edu.

comment.body:
Amy, I can remove you, but if I do that, you will not be able to email them (you have to be a manager of the group to email the group). To change your email settings without removing yourself:
Go to groups.google.com Click on My Groups Click on the drop down and choose No email
To remove yourself from the group (you will no longer be able to email those groups):
Go to groups.google.com Click on My Groups Choose Leave group
Let me know if this worked for you or if you still need help. Kristina

incident.name: Locate SSN on MetroNet spreadsheet
incident.description: 4/24/2019 -- Received MetroNet file with data in two columns: FirstName and Lastname.  Need SSN. 1.  First lookup matching both FirstName and Lastname with Colleague PERSON FIRST_NAME and LAST_NAME.  Some MetroNet records extracted several PERSON records. 2.  Second lookup from the group of first lookup -- matching  PERSON BIRTH_NAME_FIRST and BIRTH_NAME_LAST, then updating records with current FIRST_NAME and LAST_NAME 3.  Third group -- manual lookup via NAE Lillian
incident.description_no_html: 4/24/2019 -- Received MetroNet file with data in two columns: FirstName and Lastname. Need SSN. 1. First lookup matching both FirstName and Lastname with Colleague PERSON FIRST_NAME and LAST_NAME. Some MetroNet records extracted several PERSON records. 2. Second lookup from the group of first lookup -- matching PERSON BIRTH_NAME_FIRST and BIRTH_NAME_LAST, then updating records with current FIRST_NAME and LAST_NAME 3. Third group -- manual lookup via NAE Lillian
incident.resolution_description:
4/24/2019 -- Attached file added columns for Colleague data and Notes.
Lillian

incident.name: Hold music on 7711 rollover
incident.description: The main Security phone next to the switchboard has several buttons labeled 7711 and the second one (key 1) is a rollover line that is flashing and when they attempt to pick up the line, they hear classical music as if it's on hold but can't seem to disconnect to free up the line.
incident.description_no_html: The main Security phone next to the switchboard has several buttons labeled 7711 and the second one (key 1) is a rollover line that is flashing and when they attempt to pick up the line, they hear classical music as if it's on hold but can't seem to disconnect to free up the line.
incident.resolution_description: Some glitch seems to have connected the extension connect to hold music somewhere. I disconnected the MARP and moved all the instances to different TNs free up the line. Tested the Security phone and things seem to be back to normal.

incident.name: Fwd: Apple Developer Program Support Case 100795329594
incident.description: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dahlstrom, Karen <karendahlstrom@augustana.edu> Date: Wed, Apr 24, 2019 at 10:04 AM Subject: Re: Apple Developer Program Support Case 100795329594 To: Beattie, Shawn <shawnbeattie@augustana.edu> I really appreciate it! I think since you're the owner of the account, you have to do the next steps. They've told me that you can pick up on slide #28 on the document below. I've also include a few instructions below where apparently the slide deck isn't quite current. If you run into issues, please let me know! Thanks! Karen Apple Developer Registration.pdf Good afternoon, It appears we're missing a permission to build mobile apps on the Apple developer account. Could someone log in and check this box under "Developer Resources" on our profile? Below are the features that are enabled on our account when this box is checked, in case you are wondering. We need this enabled in order to create the mobile app. Thank you, and please let me know if you have any questions. On Tue, Apr 23, 2019 at 1:12 PM Beattie, Shawn <shawnbeattie@augustana.edu> wrote: Sure, if I can take care of it I'd be happy to help. Shawn On Tue, Apr 23, 2019 at 11:12 AM Dahlstrom, Karen <karendahlstrom@augustana.edu> wrote: Hi Shawn, We are working with a company to host a mobile app and texting platform, and part of the implementation is to set up an Apple Developer account. Can I send you the documentation from the vendor for our next steps from here to get everything set up? Thanks, Karen On Mon, Apr 15, 2019 at 8:15 AM Beattie, Shawn <shawnbeattie@augustana.edu> wrote: Hi Karen, can I help with anything? Shawn ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: <devprograms@apple.com> Date: Sun, Apr 14, 2019 at 10:22 AM Subject: Apple Developer Program Support Case 100795329594 To: <ios-app-developer@augustana.edu> Hello Shawn, This is LaRinda with Apple Developer Program Support. Apple Developer Program Support received an inquiry from the person below about Augustana College's Apple Developer Program membership: Karen Dahlstrom 309-737-3698 karendahlstrom@augustana.edu To protect your organization's privacy, we did not provide any information, but are forwarding Karen's contact details to you as requested. If you would like us to support future contacts from Karen, you can add her to your development team. For more information about roles and user management, see: App Store Connect Help If you have any further questions for me, please respond to this email or contact us at any time. We are here to help. Please reference this case number: 100795329594 Apple Developer Program Support Monday through Friday 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. central time Best regards, LaRinda Apple Inc. -- Karen Dahlstrom '04 Executive Director of Admissions Augustana College 639 38th Street Rock Island, IL 61201 Direct: 309.794.7834 Email: karendahlstrom@augustana.edu Find out more: www.augustana.edu -- Karen Dahlstrom '04 Executive Director of Admissions Augustana College 639 38th Street Rock Island, IL 61201 Direct: 309.794.7834 Email: karendahlstrom@augustana.edu Find out more: www.augustana.edu

incident.name: Microsoft Word/d.doc.live problems after update
incident.description: I use OneDrive, on two computers at home and here in the office. I've used this as the main storage place for files for a good couple of years now. Since the update in my office, Word has been finicky when opened from OneDrive, and a "d.doc.live" box pops up asking me to sign in. I sign in, and another duplicate box pops up asking me to sign in again. I'll kill the second box, and the Word doc will finally open, but as a kind of "save as" file. Also, I'll sometimes need to sign in before saving a change to an existing file, even though I thought I was already signed in. It's annoying and a waste of time and a little scary in that I'm never sure if documents are saving/syncing correctly. Any help would be appreciated.
incident.description_no_html: I use OneDrive, on two computers at home and here in the office. I've used this as the main storage place for files for a good couple of years now. Since the update in my office, Word has been finicky when opened from OneDrive, and a "d.doc.live" box pops up asking me to sign in. I sign in, and another duplicate box pops up asking me to sign in again. I'll kill the second box, and the Word doc will finally open, but as a kind of "save as" file. Also, I'll sometimes need to sign in before saving a change to an existing file, even though I thought I was already signed in. It's annoying and a waste of time and a little scary in that I'm never sure if documents are saving/syncing correctly. Any help would be appreciated.

incident.name: Missing printer on Music Library Computer
incident.description: We need the print driver installed for the WVIK Multi_Q printer, located in the music library, on the music library computer. Early today we discovered the printer was no longer responding to and was still connected to the print que on Heimdahl. When I attempted to update and add the new printer, I was not able to locate it with the other WVIK printers. Thanks, Colleen

incident.name: SpecialCollectionsMFP Papercut issue
incident.description: Hi, The multi-function printer in Special Collections (Tredway Library, 1st floor) is stuck on a PaperCut screen that asks for the device name and server IP/host information.  I'm attaching a picture of the screen for reference. Special Collections is only open 1:00-5:00 p.m. Monday-Thursday, but I am here full-time and am usually working in the back area.  There is a doorbell to the left of the door to the reading room, so if you find the reading room dark and the door locked, please ring the doorbell.  You can also call x7317 or email me before coming over to make sure I'm available.  Donna Hill in the ILL/Technical Services office (1st floor of the library) also has a key and might be available to let you in if I'm not here. Thank you! Emma Lincoln Special Collections Librarian
incident.description_no_html: Hi, The multi-function printer in Special Collections (Tredway Library, 1st floor) is stuck on a PaperCut screen that asks for the device name and server IP/host information. I'm attaching a picture of the screen for reference. Special Collections is only open 1:00-5:00 p.m. Monday-Thursday, but I am here full-time and am usually working in the back area. There is a doorbell to the left of the door to the reading room, so if you find the reading room dark and the door locked, please ring the doorbell. You can also call x7317 or email me before coming over to make sure I'm available. Donna Hill in the ILL/Technical Services office (1st floor of the library) also has a key and might be available to let you in if I'm not here. Thank you! Emma Lincoln Special Collections Librarian

business_record.name: Default Business Hours
business_record.description: This is your initial business hours record

comment.body: Hi Emma, this is similar to the previous problem where the printer "forgot" its settings.  Has this been reported to OMC?

Hi Shawn, Yes, this appears to be the same problem we had before, and no, I haven't reported it to OMC because last time they told me it was a Papercut issue and referred me to ITS.  I can call it in to them if you think that will help, but what should I tell them if they try to send me back to you again?  I don't actually remember how this was resolved last time, and now I'm wishing I had taken some notes! Thanks, Emma
Emma, the problem is the Papercut client running on the MFP keeps 'forgetting' its settings.  I know they hope to replace this device very soon.
I would recommend reporting the issue to OMC.  All other devices are connecting to Papercut just fine.  Let me know if you run into any difficulties.

incident.name: smtp.augustana.edu seems not accepting MFP scans
incident.description: We are having problems scanning and sending documents to our email addresses here in GeoSciences.  The error message on our printer says "Check the host name of the SMTP server in the COMMAND CENTER RX."  I restarted my computer and the printer, but it still has the error message and will not send the document.  Susan Wolf tried it too and she also had the same error message. Thanks for your help with this, Jen
incident.description_no_html: We are having problems scanning and sending documents to our email addresses here in GeoSciences. The error message on our printer says "Check the host name of the SMTP server in the COMMAND CENTER RX." I restarted my computer and the printer, but it still has the error message and will not send the document. Susan Wolf tried it too and she also had the same error message. Thanks for your help with this, Jen
incident.resolution_description: DNS memory leak on Freya. Restarted DNS services and smtp.augustana.edu is now responding.

incident.name: Fwd: Phone Line Trouble
incident.description: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ferguson, Roberta <robertaferguson@augustana.edu> Date: Mon, Apr 22, 2019 at 1:57 PM Subject: Phone Line Trouble To: ITS Helpdesk <helpdesk@augustana.edu> Hello Help Desk,  I have had two instances of callers receiving a "call could not be completed as dialed" error message. One was an external caller, and one was an internal, campus network caller.  Although I am receiving calls, it could be very discouraging to prospective families to received this error message when trying to call our office.  Could someone please look into this issue?  Thank you for your assistance,  Roberta Ferguson Financial Aid Assistant Augustana College 309-794-7207
incident.description_no_html: ---------- Forwarded message ---------From: Ferguson, Roberta Date: Mon, Apr 22, 2019 at 1:57 PMSubject: Phone Line TroubleTo: ITS Helpdesk Hello Help Desk,  I have had two instances of callers receiving a "call could not be completed as dialed" error message. One was an external caller, and one was an internal, campus network caller.  Although I am receiving calls, it could be very discouraging to prospective families to received this error message when trying to call our office.  Could someone please look into this issue?  Thank you for your assistance,  Roberta Ferguson Financial Aid Assistant Augustana College 309-794-7207

comment.body: The "call could not be completed as dialed" message is usually an issue with the dialing method or routing by the callers provider.  This usually happens if they don't dial the phone number properly (i.e. sometimes the area code is not needed for a caller). If a call went to a non-working number, they should receive a message more along the lines of "the number you dialed is not in service."  Internal callers who use the four digit extension should just get an immediate busy signal beep when trying to call a none working number. We will investigate to see if there is an issue with routing calls but it is likely just a fluke.

incident.name: WVIK Constituents Access DB corrupt
incident.description: I discovered on April 11th that the WVIK Constinuents Access database was corrupted when I started getting error messages of ["ID" is not an index in this table.] I've attempted to compact it and repair with no success.  In reading up on the error code, the only solution appears to rebuild the database in  a new Access file.  However, I've been using this all year and would like to preserve the many queries I've build so far.  Is it possible to revert this file to a back up taken before April 11th?
incident.description_no_html: I discovered on April 11th that the WVIK Constinuents Access database was corrupted when I started getting error messages of ["ID" is not an index in this table.] I've attempted to compact it and repair with no success. In reading up on the error code, the only solution appears to rebuild the database in a new Access file. However, I've been using this all year and would like to preserve the many queries I've build so far. Is it possible to revert this file to a back up taken before April 11th?
incident.resolution_description:
Had Scott restore a copy of the db as of 4/11/2019.
Ran the MS-Access compact and repair to shrink db size.

comment.body: S:\WVIK Colleague\WVIK DATA  Both versions are corrupt: Backup of WVIK Constituents.accdb WVIK Constiuents.accdb --  Colleen Sibthorp, Director of Finance and Membership WVIK 90.3 FM, Quad Cities NPR 639 38th Street Rock Island, IL 61201 p(309)794-7741 Become a member of WVIK. Join online today at wvik.org WVIK creates value by enhancing public life and promoting community dialog by engaging its audience through cultural, educational, news and music programming. On Mon, Apr 22, 2019 at 3:39 PM Bjork, Brad <bradbjork@augustana.edu> wrote:

Brad, Just to confirm, the restored version is available in the "Restored" folder and I can get rid of the rest? --  Colleen Sibthorp, Director of Finance and Membership WVIK 90.3 FM, Quad Cities NPR 639 38th Street Rock Island, IL 61201 p(309)794-7741 Become a member of WVIK. Join online today at wvik.org WVIK creates value by enhancing public life and promoting community dialog by engaging its audience through cultural, educational, news and music programming. On Tue, Apr 23, 2019 at 8:49 AM Bjork, Brad <bradbjork@augustana.edu> wrote:

incident.resolution:
Had Scott restore a copy of the db as of 4/11/2019.
Ran the MS-Access compact and repair to shrink db size.

incident.name: LokiWifi offline
incident.description: Got a notification from Google WiFi app that the network was offline as of 10:35am on April 21st.
incident.description_no_html: Got a notification from Google WiFi app that the network was offline as of 10:35am on April 21st.
incident.resolution_description:
The network was visible when I pulled up to the house but the modem seemed to be offline so I rebooted both pieces of equipment. "LokiWiFi" is reporting properly again
